output.conclusion: By completing this course, participants will gain a comprehensive understanding of the threats posed by quantum computers to current encryption methods and the strategies for implementing quantum-safe cryptographic solutions. They will be equipped to evaluate, select, and deploy appropriate quantum-resistant algorithms and protocols in their respective fields.
output.courseTitle: Quantum-Safe Encryption: Securing Data in the Quantum Age
output.introduction: This advanced course provides a deep dive into the emerging field of quantum-safe encryption. It addresses the imminent threat posed by quantum computers to widely used cryptographic algorithms and explores the principles, techniques, and practical considerations for implementing quantum-resistant solutions. The course is designed for cryptographers, security professionals, system architects, and anyone seeking to understand and mitigate the risks associated with quantum computing.

chapters.chapterTitle: Introduction to Quantum Computing and Cryptography
chapters.description: Overview of quantum computing principles, including qubits, superposition, and entanglement. Introduction to Shor's algorithm and its implications for breaking RSA and ECC. Discussion of Grover's algorithm and its impact on symmetric key cryptography.

The NIST PQC standardization process: goals, criteria, and timeline. Overview of the candidate algorithms in each category (lattice-based, code-based, multivariate, hash-based, and isogeny-based). Discussion of the challenges and considerations in selecting and deploying PQC algorithms.

modules.moduleTitle: Quantum Computing Threats and PQC Standardization

chapters.description: Introduction to lattice-based cryptography: principles, advantages, and disadvantages. Overview of Learning With Errors (LWE) and Ring-LWE problems. Discussion of CRYSTALS-Kyber (key exchange) and CRYSTALS-Dilithium (digital signature) algorithms.

Introduction to code-based cryptography: principles, advantages, and disadvantages. Overview of the McEliece cryptosystem and its variants. Discussion of the challenges in implementing and deploying code-based cryptography.
Introduction to hash-based signatures: principles, advantages, and disadvantages. Overview of Merkle signatures and their variants. Discussion of SPHINCS+ and its security properties.

Introduction to multivariate cryptography: principles, advantages, and disadvantages. Overview of the Rainbow signature scheme. Discussion of the challenges in implementing and securing multivariate cryptographic systems.

modules.moduleTitle: Alternative PQC Approaches: Hash-Based and Multivariate Cryptography

chapters.description: Introduction to Quantum Key Distribution (QKD): principles, protocols (BB84, E91), and limitations. Discussion of the practical considerations in deploying QKD systems. Comparison of QKD and PQC.

Strategies for migrating to quantum-safe cryptography. Discussion of hybrid approaches combining classical and post-quantum algorithms. Considerations for key management, certificate authorities, and hardware security modules (HSMs) in a post-quantum world.

modules.moduleTitle: QKD, Migration Strategies, and the Future of Encryption
